snippet: A Supreme Court decision to strike down subsidies for insurance could carry political risks, pushing the party to try to come up with alternatives to the Affordable Care Act.
abstract: Congressional Republicans are scrambling to create alternative to Pres Obama's Affordable Care Act, having realized that success in overturning law in Supreme Court will also leave them responsible for healthcare options of American citizens; some are also blaming Obama administration for not having alternative in place should they win in court.
lead_paragraph: A Supreme Court decision to strike down subsidies for insurance could carry political risks, pushing the party to try to come up with alternatives to the Affordable Care Act.

headline.main: Health Law Case Poses Conundrum for Republicans
headline.print_headline: Health Law Case Poses Conundrum for Republicans

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
